medical_history.history_of_present_illness: Symptoms began shortly after birth (30 minutes post-delivery) with severe hypoglycemia observed, presenting with a glucose level of 31 mg/dl. Despite medical treatment, including intravenous glucose and medications, the patient continued to experience severe hypoglycemic episodes.
medical_history.past_medical_history: The patient presented with macrosomia at birth and underwent subtotal pancreatectomy at 5 months due to severe hyperinsulinemic hypoglycemia. Post-surgery, the patient developed diabetes, requiring insulin treatment.
medical_history.family_history: Both parents are heterozygous carriers of the identified mutation but have not experienced hypoglycemic episodes.
